text: Under the 6-week tab got the price to $80,000
<@U0B9N0HF0|rob> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/rob/F0NT1KK7E/chronospendantresourceestimates-phases-weekly|Chronos Pendant Resource Estimates>
Here’s a more detailed breakdown: <https://docs.google.com/a/uncorkedstudios.com/spreadsheets/d/1ynsH7DNNHaqO825dYtUKA3K-PvE7K76uDGdbZojZ2Qc/edit?usp=sharing>
<@U0B9N0HF0|rob> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/rob/F0NT7LDF1/pendantresearch-taskbasedbudget|Pendant Research>

In the Pendant Research tab, you will find 3 tabs. 1.)  *Updated Uncorked Proposal* takes Elena’s proposal and imagines it with 3 roles (strategist, designer, producer). This version is  imagining we did it ourselves and it comes in at 80k.  The second tab 2.) *Elena’s Proposal + Uncorked Hours* takes Elena’s proposal at face value w/o any cuts and adds Producer and CD hrs. in 4/8 hr. increments with the exception being research where I mirrored the hrs. of Carl and Elena. This version comes in at just under 110k  3.) *Elena Proposal w/o Uncorked Research* participation takes Elena’s proposal at face value w/o any cuts, adds Uncorked CD and Producer time for all activities that aren’t direct research.
That one comes in just smidge under 100k. All proposals are at our rate. Confusing enough? :simple_smile:
cool.  <@U0B9N0HF0> Chronos can send us the application via test flight.  can we get a dev to set  up some kind of acceptance of this?
looking at other stuff and getting back to luke now

<@U02918BKW>: Rob just took me through his analysis from the day.  My topline understanding and insight into how I’ll navigate the call -  Budget feels like 85k.  
If we can assume to get Elena down to 125/hr she comes in at 40k.  Our revenue opp is 32k + mark up for her pass through (figure 10k) puts us at 82k.  But we have to figure out the project’s value to us.  
For Luke the value adds are: in discussing, we identified additional hypothesis which expanded the scope of our research for instance talking to jewlers and jewelry wearers so another audience segment as well as additional time for synthesis.  Also, we recruited a research team member who is an expert in the wearables space (gave keynote talks, worked at ziba)
I am not assuming Elena will concede rate in the short term.
Probably top 1% of diligent on contracts, her.
ok so if she remains at 50k and our revenue opp is 32k, what do we want to think about marking up her rate?  we last proposed 60k to luke, going from 60 to above 85k might be a tricky convo
Did both timeline go from 4 to 6 and additional resource get added since the 60 estimate?
yes
That seems like a new approach that's valid to propose - the only issue is if he says he would rather do the 60k route, Elena seems firm on not doing that?
good call charles, pretty firm
and yeah i feel ya ‘new approach’ but stil a little rich for my blood (in clients shoes)
50% more calendar and 33% more resource makes the full price proposal justified. I definitely don't want us to offer a fixed bid that assumes a diet on the resources we apply. :)
It's a revised proposal, not an option to choose from
Elena responded to email, not vectoring towards discounts but NTE terms are in reach for sure.
Haha okaaaay we will do the cheap version
Nte?

I think it's maybe just "look, we have consulted with our research partner and given the competitive landscape and what it would take for this project to be succesful, we will bring in some subject matter experts and dedicate more time to this to really let it shine. "
yeah i dig all that.  not gonna pull together a preso unless luke asks (for SDC) or investor sake.  i’m cool having this convo
but hey <@U02918BKW>, full budget is no less than 100k.  if youre cool with that as a number and a convo piece we’re all set
i can have <@U0B9N0HF0> work with me on vetting the estimates (last time, we backed into a number based on previous convos)
did I miss the jump from 85 to 100?
yeah, 85 assumed elena brought down her rate to 125
was that a pass-through model? i am not sure why elena's rate has any impact to client price
Chiming in here: the impact of Elena bringing down her rate was to make a more palatable client price tag
client price should be based on the work that needs to be performed, not the cost of work performed.
so if elena gives us hours, then we should have those in our model, at our rate.
granted, an unexpected overage if she's not offering a fixed bid could change the end result
Yeah. The models we have incorporate Elena's hours at our rate. 85k isn't in any model. More a gut feeling about where we felt the price could land with negotiation w/ client and Elena
If we go by models it's 100-110k based on Uncorked's resource allocations. Sorry for confusion.
to be clear, under normal business circumstances i would not offer a client a penny less than $200/hr for any work estimated, be it by us or a subcontractor that we provide.

Understood. We are all on same page here. Pricing reality, arrived upon after receiving  elenas approach and accounted for in robs model comes to 100-110. Or almost twice was luke  is currently in receipt of. I'm cool to have convo as we have discussed but I expect there to be some hesitation at a doubling in price. Thinking we need to be ready to make cuts to keep alive.
cuts to scope
we dont cut price unless there's some high degree of merit
100% on board. 85k was a scope cut.  Not a rate cut.

Yes understood. Rate is rate :). When we talked this am we talked about keeping scope intact because Elena is professional with best foot forward. Will take one more look at scope tomorrow to assess areas for cuts to be ready. Otherwise johns phrasing of 50% more time + additional resource is the justification.
